results.title: Account Executive
results.description:
Have you wondered whether it’s possible to find gratifying work in a fast-paced startup that is also mission focused?

Join EarlyBird Education where we are leveraging cutting-edge brain science, artificial intelligence and gamification to prevent reading struggles. Children play a game and we can identify whether they are at risk for reading difficulties, like dyslexia - even before they learn to read - and in the window when intervention re-wires the brain for reading success. With a mission to scale this to all children nationwide, EarlyBird is already in use in schools across the country with thousands of children. Join this fast growing, venture-funded team as we provide essential data, tools and resources to support educators, parents and pediatricians to change the learning trajectory of children nationwide.

As an Account Executive, and critical early employee of this startup company, you will play a major role in scaling this next-generation education technology. We’ll look to you to do what you do best; to bring fresh ideas to the table that can make our products, our work and our team better. This is your opportunity to play a key role in a company that is transforming the way young children learn.

Responsibilities

  • Qualify inbound leads and convert those leads into new partnerships
  • Craft and execute outbound strategy in partnership with EarlyBird’s instructional experts, and key opinion leaders in specific markets
  • Optimize sales process with Marketing, Sales Leader and Customer Success
  • Update CRM with learnings and pipeline projections

Skills and Experience

  • 1-4 years experience as a quota-carrying sales representative and/or sales closer experience in K-12 education (preferably SaaS and/or assessment)
  • Deep understanding of early literacy curriculum, instruction, and assessment as it pertains to the Science of Reading.
  • Ability to connect and build trust with school and district decision-makers
  • Ability to navigate complex early literacy conversations with enthusiasm, substance and nuance
  • Self-motivated with ability to work in fast paced, changing environment

What you will get out of this role

  • The chance to connect with educators around a really challenging, complex, and critical instructional problem in schools by scaling the reach of EarlyBird to tens of thousands of students.
  • A chance to build the growth engine of a research-driven education company from the ground up without compromising integrity, ambition, or fun.
  • A direct line to the product development team to share feedback from the field in order to make EarlyBird the strongest PreK-3 literacy platform in the market.
  • Become knowledgeable in early literacy instruction and dyslexia screening from some of the world’s foremost experts.
  • Contribute meaningfully to the culture of an inclusive, dynamic, and substantive growth team at a mission-driven education technology company.
  • Leadership opportunities to drive innovative approaches to pipeline development and positioning in the K-12 market.

Culture - We are building a team that brings a joyful urgency to this serious and critical work. We are science-driven and crave feedback. We assume best intentions and look for opportunities to lift our teammates up. We are transparent and humble with our customers while also being proud of the value and service we can provide them. Below are a few of the beliefs that we hold as a team and the type of person we think will do well on our team:

Beliefs

  • All children are capable of learning at a high level
  • Every child deserves access to evidence-based literacy instruction tailored to their needs
  • Educators deserve comprehensive literacy assessment data that is accessible and actionable.
  • Schools and districts need instructional and technology partners that build the tools and provide the support that are targeted and responsive to their feedback.
  • We have the team, technology, and focus to meaningfully change the trajectory of millions of children’s lives.

Professional Traits

  • Organized and strong time management skills
  • Excellent writer; you enjoy crafting a message for a particular person and then revising that message over time as you look at the effectiveness of your initial attempt.
  • Self-aware and persuasive communicator; you make space for others to share their passion and expertise while knowing when you can contribute most to individual and group conversations.
  • A thirst for knowledge and growth in a mission-driven start-up; your skills and ambition could take you anywhere, but you are motivated each day by the fact that our solution helps teachers empower and liberate students from reading difficulties.
  • A sense of urgency and persistence; the window for intervention for millions of kids is now and you are driven to meet that moment for those children.
  • Flexible; we're a small company that moves and reacts fast when there is sufficient data and evidence to justify a change in direction.

Benefits

Benefits

  • Critical early member of a startup team
  • Competitive Compensation
  • Fun & Flexible Team
  • Unlimited vacation and flexible work hours
  • Excellent health and dental insurance
  • Paid parental leave
  • Home Office Setup Stipend
  • Remote team, with regular company gatherings

results.title: Enterprise SaaS Account Executive
results.description:
About Fable

Fable is a Toronto-based accessibility company that is helping businesses make their digital products and services accessible to a billion people with disabilities worldwide. We’ve built a platform that connects digital teams to people with disabilities for user research and testing. Our customers include Walmart, Slack, Shopify and many more. Recently listed as Linkedin’s ranked top #3 for growing companies in Canada.

About the role

As an Enterprise Account Executive, you will directly contribute to bringing Fable’s mission to life in the world. You will be responsible for managing enterprise sales cycles from deal qualification all the way through complex procurement processes. You must be world class when it comes to active listening, empathy and practicing a challenger sale to guide Prospects in how best to evaluate and purchase Fable’s products. You will gain experience interacting with enterprise clients in a variety of industries including ecommerce, education, entertainment, finance, government and more.

There are countless companies who can greatly benefit from working with Fable. You will be a consultative expert to help determine prospect needs and articulate Fable's value proposition. Being proactive, creative, likeable, and persuasive will be key to your success.

The focus of this role will be on:

  • Probing for Prospect pain points, requirements, and strategic objectives
  • Scoping engagements to create the solutions to Prospect’s problems
  • Effectively negotiating in a win-win mindset to drive technical selection quickly
  • Taking control of the procurement and legal processes to maximize the speed to close
  • Leading Prospects through the buyer’s journey proactively and assertively
  • This role is a new business closing role

Responsibilities:

  • Accurately documenting the sales process in our CRM
  • Meeting or exceeding your quarterly targets
  • Understanding the needs of the company and participating in sales meetings and training programs
  • Deepening your knowledge in the accessibility domain
  • Improving sales processes and helping the sales team to grow
  • Contributing to making Fable the most inclusive workplace possible

Requirements

Must have:

  • Established track record of target achievement in enterprise software sales for at least two years
  • Highly organized and resourceful; expert active listener
  • Excellent work ethic – self-motivated and driven to exceed targets set for you
  • Ability to self-coach – you observe yourself in real time and can make adjustments in real time
  • Demonstrated experience closing a complex sale with multiple steps including managing procurement and legal
  • Outgoing and engaging personality with a preference for collaboratively working with a team

Benefits

What’s in it for you?

At Fable, you'll join a vibrant and rapid growth environment where you'll work with individuals who share the same values of being passionate, socially driven, inclusive, collaborative and respectful. We offer great benefits such as stock options, career progression, professional development, health/dental benefits and more. Fable is a remote-first company and welcomes applications from candidates in Canada and the U.S.

Compensation:

This position will operate on a base salary plus performance-based commissions.

OTE range: CAD $160,000 - $250,000/yr (50/50 Split) - this is subject to change and is dependent on experience.

Accessibility accommodation

Fable is an inclusive workplace. If you are facing any accessibility requirements or concerns regarding the hiring process or employment with us, please notify us at jobs@makeitfable.com and include the subject line “Accessibility accommodation for Enterprise SaaS Account Executive job application.”

results.title: Enterprise Account Executive, Biopharma
results.description:
Ganymede is building AWS for the sciences, with a mission of improving the world through better healthcare outcomes. Our platform is the most powerful way to integrate lab instruments, apps, and databases together in a single data lake, and drive automation between them.

As Ganymede's most senior salesperson in the biopharma vertical, you'll play an integral role closing the largest accounts as well as developing overall sales strategy for the commercial team as a whole. You'll sell highly complex cloud software products in complex and long enterprise sales processes, but will achieve large sales numbers and commissions in return. The entire Ganymede team will be ready to support your success, from engineering, to marketing, to the founders who you'll work very directly on a daily basis with to close sales.

Our Principles

  • Improving lives through better medicine: we’re intensely mission-focused, and are building a highly scalable business to make an impact on society.
  • Kindness: we come from a future where all human beings are treated with dignity, inclusivity, and active empathy, so we apply that to ourselves first in how we hire and treat each other.
  • Transparency: we are one team, and hold that openness is foundational to ensuring fairness, and that our actions tie to our shared mission.
  • Accountability: we believe that trust is the basis for building anything substantial, and stems from our being accountable to ourselves and each other.

Requirements

What we look for:

  • 6+ years of experience in enterprise software sales to biotechs, pharma, or manufacturing (ideally SaaS)
  • Deep relationships with multiple high-potential accounts
  • Successful track record of closing 6-7 figure ARR deals and hitting or exceeding quotas in an enterprise sales role
  • Ability to cultivate deep relationships with clients and develop strategic attack plans for key accounts
  • Mentorship of junior colleagues and team-members to grow overall team and department sales
  • Desire to improve software to accelerate medicine

Benefits

  • Highly competitive salary and equity as an early employee, along with industry-leading sales commissions
  • Remote-first role and culture, with periodic reimbursed travel for the team to meet together.
  • Unlimited PTO & sick days
  • Excellent health benefits (Medical, Dental & Vision), life, and disability insurance
  • Family leave (Maternity, Paternity, Medical, Caregiver)

Compensation Range
  • 150K-220K base, 400K+ OTE

results.title: Sales Executive - Jumbo Employers
results.description:
Be a part of the team building the future of healthcare!

Firefly Health is building a revolutionary new type of comprehensive health "care and coverage” plan, powered by a relationship-driven care team, a trusted virtual and in-person clinical network, and our proprietary technology platform.

Founded by experienced clinicians and technology leaders, Firefly Health is on a mission to deliver half-priced health care that's twice as good, clinically and emotionally. We are flipping the script on what it means to be a health plan and actually providing a true health benefit to members.

We are intensely focused on optimizing the physical + mental + financial wellbeing of those who want (and deserve) something better than the status quo. If you are ready to roll up your sleeves and take on our audacious mission, then we would love to hear from you.

Your Role

This Sales Executive position will be responsible for building upon our emerging jumbo employer vertical. In this role, you will be accountable for health plan sales to employers with more than 25,000 employees. As a natural storyteller and teacher, you will paint a compelling picture of our self-funded health plan solution and how it’s the long-term, sustainable solution that will support our customer’s business objectives.

You will:

  • Drive new sales with jumbo employers by developing strategies that drive top of funnel activity and efficiently move prospects to a win
  • Educate and shape the views of brokers, consultants, and employers to enhance Firefly’s place as a disruptive market leader, challenging the status quo
  • Work cross-functionally with internal teams, including Marketing, Product Development, Network Development, etc., to ensure client success and performance
  • Maintain and update employer opportunities and track sales activity metrics in our Salesforce CRM

You’d be a good fit if:

  • At least 10+ years of experience selling health plans to jumbo employers
  • Established relationships with jumbo employers and employee health benefits consultants that have a national presence
  • Deep familiarity with the process by which jumbo employers purchase a health plan for their employees (e.g., timeline, decision-making criteria, etc.)
  • Strong experience and focus selling and closing new business vs. retention of existing book of business
  • Experience championing the deal internally, coordinating resources across marketing, product, implementation and leadership
  • Strong track record of consistently meeting / exceeding large yearly quotas in the jumbo employer segment
  • Knowledge of Salesforce CRM
  • Active accident and health insurance broker license required or willingness to obtain it within 90 days from the date of hire



Our office is located in Watertown, Massachusetts but we’ve developed a robust remote working structure to give us more flexibility geographically while hiring for many positions.

This role can be done largely remotely, there are several times a year when staff come together onsite for planning and team building..

We are always looking for valuable talent to add to our growing team. Even if you’re not sure this role is the one for you, don’t let that stop you. We’d love to have a conversation to see where you could fit.

Firefly is an equal opportunity employer. We value diverse backgrounds and perspectives. We're committed to building and sustaining an inclusive workplace culture where individuals are treated with dignity and respect. All employment is decided on the basis of qualifications, merit, and business need.

results.title: Sales Operations Lead
results.description:
Stacker is seeking a Sales Operations Lead who will work closely with revenue leadership in our Studio organization to support sales operations needs. This individual will provide leaders with data analysis to provide insight into performance against goals, support timely decisions, and solve sales and operational challenges to drive more revenue for the business. This role requires a business-oriented mindset coupled with a technical acumen and an analytical prowess to understand and execute a wide-range of tasks and projects to make our go to market teams successful.


The Company

Stacker is a new media company excited by the future of journalism. Every day, our efforts center on developing new and more sustainable ways to produce, distribute, and fund great storytelling that contextualizes our world and drives impact for news publishers big and small. We do this through a number of ways—from our tech-forward storytelling method and freely accessible newswire, to offering a structured avenue for non-publisher organizations to participate and contribute to quality journalism.

Our ultimate mission is to empower the world’s publishers: through a commitment to provide free access to great storytelling and by championing innovation in how journalism is done, we enable our national- and local-scale publishing partners to engage their audiences and focus on their own original reporting.

As a bootstrapped company, we’re a resourceful team focused on building an inclusive, equitable culture around shared values of integrity, ownership, and collaboration. Building for the future is reflected in the way we work: we are remote-first, embrace flexible schedules, and offer competitive benefits and perks including unlimited vacation, an employee equity program, heath & dental coverage, and 401(k) matching.

We’re always looking for curious, media-minded thinkers to join the team. We encourage women, people of color, veterans, people with disabilities and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

Responsibilities
  • Collaborate with Studio leaders on strategic initiatives that increase sales productivity, operational efficiency, and revenue. Perform analyses on trends and performance to identify opportunities for improvement, recommend new growth drivers, and address scaling challenges. Scope, prioritize and drive a variety of projects to completion, including team training and documentation.
  • Develop and refine sales processes, systems, policies, and procedures. Assist and revamp a host of go-to-market parts, such as ideal customer profile categorizations, lead routing, pricing and packaging, pipeline tracking and account ownership.
  • Be the expert for the sales and renewal performance, forecasting and pipeline health, communicating timely analysis and insight to ensure leadership has a pulse on the business.
  • Consult with team leads to define performance metrics, tracking, analyzing and reporting on them on an ongoing basis. Build sales dashboards and run ad hoc data analysis as needed.
  • Manage the CRM and an evolving sales enablement technology stack, making enhancements to streamline processes and troubleshoot operational issues as they surface. Engage with the team to consistently obtain feedback to improve performance and drive adoption.
  • Gather sales requirements and prioritize needs to identify new tools. Facilitate discussions with vendors, create recommendations, manage onboarding through rollout and conduct training.
  • Manage CRM data integrity, performing data quality checks, importing data and running clean-up projects to improve the quality and accuracy of information to ensure the team is able to make key business decisions with confidence.
  • Assist in driving strategic planning efforts across the Studio organization, including aligning leaders on OKRs and KPIs, forecasts, and headcount plans.
  • Help establish sales/account management compensation program policies and procedures and run commission calculations. Be a thought partner in proposing new incentive designs including temporary incentives to support short term goals.
  • Create and maintain documentation on processes, guides, best practices, sales playbooks.

Assist with the onboarding and development of Studio team members, including creating and improving documentation related to systems how-tos, sales trainings, and Studio terminology.

Requirements

  • 3-5 years of experience in Sales Operations, Business Operations, Revenue Operations, Consulting, Strategy, Analytics or similar roles ideally within Tech, Media or other high-growth, fast paced environments
  • Robust experience organizing, analyzing and reporting on data. Experience creating dashboards in business intelligence tools such as Google Data Studio and Tableau is a plus.
  • Ability to track and analyze go-to-market metrics (such as CAC, LTV, Churn, etc.) and extract business insights to turn them into actionable strategies
  • Advanced proficiency analyzing data in Google Sheets / Excel using complex formulas, pivot tables, and data filters/sorts.
  • Previous experience with CRM systems (i.e. Hubspot, Salesforce) as a power user including creating reporting, managing records, cleaning duplicates, troubleshooting issues and making improvements. Experience administering Hubspot is a plus.
  • Working knowledge and/or experience navigating sales enablement, lead gen and marketing systems and tools (i.e. SalesLoft, Outreach, ZoomInfo, Mailchimp, MixMax, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc.)
  • Sales planning & strategy experience, including forecasting, setting goals, and measuring performance against quotas
  • A basic understanding of sales compensation methodologies
  • Experience with documenting and capturing processes, to-dos, and trainings
  • Highly motivated, willing to learn new technologies and able to work both independently & cross-functionally to drive projects through to completion
  • Organized with excellent prioritization skills to navigate a fast-moving, changing environment
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and ability to shift from strategic to detail-oriented initiatives
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

Benefits

Employee wellbeing is top of mind for the Stacker team. We offer the following benefits to all team members:

  • Competitive Base
  • Equity Stock Option Program
  • Full Health & Dental Coverage
  • Fully Remote Team
  • Unlimited PTO
  • 401k Matching
  • 3 Months of Paid Family Leave
  • Weekly *Treat Yourself* Stipend
  • Continuous learning curriculum
  • Annual Team Offsites
  • Monthly Virtual Social Events
  • Awesome & Inclusive team culture!

Stacker is dedicated to creating a diverse and inclusive newsroom that reflects the communities we serve. We encourage women, people of color, veterans, people with disabilities and gender nonconforming candidates to apply.

Stacker is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.

results.title: Executive Director, Enterprise Sales
results.description:
Overview

Healthcare delivery involves hundreds of repetitive, manual tasks that account for over $1 trillion in administrative costs per year. Notable’s platform unifies artificial intelligence, robotic process automation, design, and no-code configurability to automate these workflows across the continuum of care–improving patient outcomes while reducing costs. Notable’s mission is to transform how patients access care and how the health systems get paid for it. Leading healthcare organizations like CommonSpirit Health and Intermountain rely on our platform to enrich every patient interaction through modern digital experiences and intelligent automation.

Notable is looking for an ambitious Enterprise Sales Leader who is eager to prosper in a dynamic high growth environment.  In this role, you will lead, build, and manage our Enterprise sales team–including driving growth strategy, refining processes, hiring a world-class team; and, of course, closing deals. The ideal candidate has experience managing a high-performing team through scale-up to drive exponential business growth. They are adept at navigating relationships with multiple executive stakeholders of large enterprises and have the ability to successfully execute and coach consultative sales. Target client partners include IDNs, health systems, and large physician groups.

What You’ll Do:

  • Manage a team of Enterprise Sales Executives to exceed Notable’s quarterly and annual enterprise new logo goals

  • Shape Notable’s commercial strategy for new business while refining and scaling internal sales team processes 

  • Effectively engage with new prospects and win deals by using a consultative, value oriented approach that resonates with c-level decision makers

  • Demonstrate a high level of business acumen, managing the team to effectively diagnose the business needs of prospects in order to prescribe Notable solutions of highest value 

  • Drive the entire sales process from prospecting through opportunity development and deal closure, to post-sale kickoff with our Partnership Delivery team

  • Work in a dynamic scale-up where you will share feedback from the field to help shape the evolution of our product and service offerings

  • Obsess over outcomes and continuously iterate and innovate to drive the evolution of our business.



Who You Are:

  • A skilled, enterprise logo, VP+ level hunter with 10+ years in business development, consulting, healthcare, or sales, with experience having scaled an organization’s sales function

  • Have advanced proficiency with sales technologies and leveraging those tools to drive outcomes

  • An experienced sales team manager with an orientation to quick thinking and problem solving

  • A devoted team leader, dedicated to building a diverse and multi-faceted team focused on excellence

  • Proven track record of exceeding targets by running a consultative, multi-threaded sales process with large, complex prospect organizations 

  • A team player with a high level of integrity and desire to assist your tribe.  Flexibility as the organization scales rapidly is critical.

  • Approach challenges with a beginner's mind and desire to learn

  • Have proven capacity to develop relationships with key stakeholders and optimize enterprise customer accounts, you understand what it means to evangelize your product 

  • Are resourceful–might not have all the answers, but you know how to find them

  • Prior healthcare experience is required

What We Value:

  • High-performing creative leaders who have a solution mindset and dig into problems and opportunities with fervor and enthusiasm

  • Leaders who actively participate at all levels of building the business, not afraid to advocate for recommended solutions and promote big-picture thinking

  • Humility and accountability; focused on the right solution, collaboration, and empowering their employees

  • We heavily emphasize an environment of teaching and learning to equip employees with the tools needed to be successful in their function and the company.

  • Asynchronous and fluid work environment through family-friendly policies, remote benefits, and flexible time off

  • We strongly believe in the value of growing a diverse team and encourage people of all backgrounds, genders, ethnicities, abilities, and sexual orientations to apply.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
About us

Nomic was founded with the purpose of making biology easier to measure. To do this, we have untangled some of the most difficult problems in protein profiling. Our team is combining DNA nanotechnology, high-dimensional flow cytometry, laboratory automation, and machine learning to develop the world’s highest throughput proteomic platform: the nELISA.

Since spinning out of McGill University, we have partnered with and provided platform access to dozens of drug discovery groups including GSK, 4 of the top 10 pharmas, and leading biotechs.

We have recently launched a state of the art manufacturing and protein profiling facilities that enable multiplexed measurement of >2.5M samples a year, generating an effective 500M protein assays in the process.

We are building a diverse team of engineers, scientists, and world-changers. We like to break down difficult problems using a first principles approach, often leveraging the latest breakthroughs from across the scientific and technological spectrum to drive our mission forward.

 

About the Role

We are looking for our first Sales Development Representative at Nomic Bio. You will be working closely with our co-founders and our Application Scientists to expand our user base and deliver our technology to researchers and drug development scientists.

 

What you will be doing

  • Enable scientists to extend lives by delivering our high-throughput protein profiling platform and expanding our customer base.

  • Research, identify, and reach out to research groups that can leverage the nELISA.

  • Qualify inbound leads and introduce our technology and offerings.

  • Understand the users’ situation, needs, and decision-making process.

  • Maintain lead/prospect contact information and notes in CRM to manage sales prospecting and track activities.

  • Attend conferences and generate and qualify leads.

  • Nurture leads and opportunities where potential users expressed interest but were not ready to purchase at the time of initial contact.

  • Contribute to developing sales materials, playbooks and processes.

     

What we’re looking for:

  • STEM bachelor's or master's degree with a minimum of 3 years experience in Sales or a Customer-facing role.

  • Strong time-management skills including the ability to effectively multitask, and work in a fast-paced environment.

  • Possess strong verbal and written communication skills.

  • Be a curious individual with effective questioning and listening.

  • You have a sense of urgency to get things done to enable scientists and extend lives; are driven to deliver and constantly push the boundaries; can-do attitude; determination and high expectations of yourself.

 

Please apply if you:

Connect deeply with our mission, ambition and sense of duty. We developed our technology to better measure biology and discover biomarkers for the early detection of diseases. We firmly believe we will be successful in literally eradicating certain diseases by enabling them to be diagnosed and treated earlier. Are up for a challenge and want to grow: We are a team of problem-solvers, and we continually put ourselves to the test and go into the unknown. We have a growth mindset, and we rely on each other to give critical and candid feedback to ensure that we can reach our full potential.

results.title: (Senior) Account Manager (f/m/x)
results.description:
ELEMENT Insurance AG is a product factory for insurance and a leader in insurance digitalization. We supply our partners from various industries – both from an insurer, as well as a non-insurer background – with in-house underwritten insurance products, which they market under their own brand. Our modular insurance platform enables us to tailor-fit and supply these non-life insurance products in record speed. 

 

Our diverse team with over 30 nationalities combines the expertise of the worlds of insurance and technology. At ELEMENT, we live an agile and empowering company culture to work on ‘the insurance of tomorrow’.

 

ELEMENT's HR department covers the full HR service spectrum. We make it a point to use the latest methods, tools and insights in our daily work and can always count on the support of our management, who are fully aware that our employees are ELEMENT's most important success factor.

We are currently looking for a (Senior) Account Manager - (f/m/x) to help us to develop our client relationships:

 

What Will Keep You Challenged?

  • Be responsible for net growth within key customer accounts and identifying new opportunities within those relationships
  • Establish a thorough understanding of your named account's business strategy, organizational structure, and growth plans.
  • Define with your accounts the ideal product for their end customers and support them to maximize their distribution success throughout the whole customer journey.
  • Develop based on your experience together with the sales team innovative sales strategies for new and classic insurance solutions and implement them with your clients.
  • Control and report the development of your accounts.
  • Keeping up to date with changing market trends in both technical and insurance areas .
  • Capacity to work in a fast paced, entrepreneurial environment .

What Will Make You Succeed?

  • Bachelors/ Master's in business, other relevant educations will be considered 
  • Several years’ experience in an account management, sales, or related role – ideally in the insurance industry 
  • Proven record of high performance and substantial achievements in past positions  
  • Solid functional knowledge of strategy, business development, product development, project management, sales and marketing are beneficial 
  • Proficient expertise with CRM software and Microsoft Office programs is essential 
  • Experience with Jira, Salesforce and Online Marketing Expertise (Google Analytics, SEO, Google/Facebook Ads) are a plus 
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, ability to influence others, work well with people on all levels of the organization 
  • Strategic thinking skill and complex problem-solving abilities 
  • Exceptional communication skill, both fluency in German and English are required

Why ELEMENT?

  • The opportunity to be part of a driven and diverse team which is creating a measurable impact on our company as well as the future of insurance.
  • An open and welcoming company culture, empowering you to freely grow and take your career to the next level.
  • We openly share our knowledge – we are a mix of insurance experts, technology specialists and experienced entrepreneurs.
  • We have a dedicated onboarding process, enabling you to quickly thrive at ELEMENT.
  • A direct influence on our company and business – we value your ideas and your input.
  • Plenty of perks including a benefits package of your own design, 30 days of holidays, free drinks and snacks, language classes, company-wide networking events and outings.

 

Research shows that men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria. Meanwhile, women and other diverse groups often only apply if they check every box. So if you might have what it takes, but don't quite meet every single point on the job description, we invite you to get in touch either way and let's discover together if you could be a great fit.

 

We look forward to hearing from you!

results.title: National Account Executive
results.description:
National Account Executive - 12 Month FTC
Client Growth Delivered (Homebased)

The role of the SalesOut National Account Executive is to support the National Account Manager(s) aim of partnering with SalesOut customer(s) and ensuring long-term success. This is achieved through regular collaboration, networking and training with the customer's teams and their suppliers to deliver a great customer experience and the successful delivery of our solutions.  They will need to understand their customer(s) / suppliers(s) key growth strategy and support them by the use of the SalesOut system to identify any potential growth areas, that will in turn add value, drive profitable sales, increase income streams and provide a return on investment to all parties against the SalesOut system.

The primary focus of the role is to build and maintain strong relationships with key internal and external stakeholders, to deliver year on year renewals of existing and new data subscriptions and revenue, plus use any other activities or initiatives as required (such as analytics to the wholesaler management team), to grow our income or add value.

The National Account Executive will need to spend time with the Account Management team (and their wholesalers) to build a strong network of contacts and to work with them collaboratively as a trusted partner.  They will also spend time in the IRI Bracknell office to liaise face to face with cross-functional and internal teams, to ensure we deliver a great customer experience, providing timely and successful delivery of our solutions and executing with excellence.

Main role responsibilities:

  • Support towards the deliverable targets for Wholesaler Revenue (Contract, Subscriptions, Smart Cash etc)

 

  • Support the Account Management team with new and ongoing key projects aligned to the business strategy

 

  • Develop and maintain relationships with their customer(s) and their suppliers to primarily deliver long-term subscriptions, as well as additional upsells such as analytics

 

  • Cross-functional department working to support the resolving of issues or challenges

 

  • Deliver regular insightful training to ensure all system users are fully proficient

 

  • Understand user volume and stats and take appropriate action where needed

 

  • Ownership of quality data reviews and processes (Quality appraisal of the Data & QA Checks)

 

  • Maintain high customer satisfaction ratings, according to company standards

 

  • Support with admin-based tasks, such as processing contracts, user/client setups and infrequently supporting the Customer Service team

 

  • Developing an understanding of how the wholesale industry operates and using this knowledge to optimise the experience provided to clients and making them aware of the services we provide / offer

 

Skills and Experience Required:

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills, ideally comfortable in a consultative, client-facing environment

 

  • Strong quantitative and analytical skills with the ability to draw conclusions based on data

 

  • Experience with sales performance metrics and statistics

 

  • Ability to investigate, analyse & solve problems, and clearly communicate results

 

  • MS Office fluency, including Excel pivot tables & chart making.

 

  • Confident nature, good presentation skills and interpersonal skills

 

  • A motivated, self-starter with a flexible ‘can do' attitude, high energy and drive

 

  • Excellent communication, organisation and prioritisation skills

 

  • Ability to drive, with a clean driving licence and available to travel when required

 

  • Knowledge of the FMCG wholesale/retail industry preferable (but not required)


ABOUT IRI:

What we do:
IRI is a leading provider of big data, predictive analytics and forward-looking insights that help FMCG, healthcare, retailers, and media companies to grow their businesses. With the largest collection of purchase, media, social, causal and loyalty data, all integrated on an on-demand cloud-based technology platform, IRI guides its clients around the world in their quests to remain relevant, capture market share, connect with consumers, and deliver market leading growth.

Who we are:

As well as the technical skills, experience and attributes that are required for the role, our values sit at the core of our organisation. Therefore we always look for people who can continuously champion our values through-out the business within their day-to-day role:-

  • Collaboration:
    The ability to work as a wider team and consider the business as a whole in every action
  • Personal Development:
    Pro-actively seek out new ways to develop your skills and become more effective within your role
  • Executional Excellence:
    Superb attention to detail with the ability to plan effectively for the future
  • Client Growth:
    Natural ability to nurture client relationships and deliver sustainable business growth to clients
  • Innovation:
    Consistently seek out new ways to approach every task/situation
  • Creativity:
    Continuously challenge the way we do things and how we can make our offering different to our competitors

 

What working for IRI can do for you:

  • Long-term career development in a market-leading organisation.
  • Competitive salary and impressive benefit package to match.
  • Working in an international company with opportunities across the UK and globally.
  • Bespoke training to suit your individual needs and development.
  • Friendly working environment with regular social events planned by our internal social committee through-out the year.

results.title: Sales Development Representative
results.description:
Genesis is a Ukrainian co-founding company that builds global tech businesses together with outstanding entrepreneurs from CEE. The Genesis business ecosystem includes more than 25 projects that work in 4 areas — mobile applications, online media, classifieds, and R&D. Our applications have been downloaded by more than 300 million users worldwide, with the company's main markets being the United States, Europe, and Africa.

In 2021, we launched a new project - YouTube Multi-Channel Network, Genesis MCN is an official, certified partner of YouTube.
The company's portfolio includes content creators from Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Africa, and other world regions. We help them develop their media business: create, promote and monetize their content in the best possible way.

We are looking for an enterprising and experienced Sales Development Representative and a person with whom we will enjoy joint victories. This role opens up the possibility of professional development in interesting non-standard tasks for various projects and career growth to Team Lead of Sales.

 

What will you do:

  • attracting new partners (YouTube channels);
  • conducting market research;
  • search for potential partners according to the company's criteria and enter them into the hunting table;
  • compiling and sending Follow-up;
  • elaboration of a commercial offer for each partner, depending on his needs;
  • conducting calls and meetings to present the company's services and conclude agreements;
  • dealing with objections;
  • organization of contract signing;
  • creation of a partner card with complete information about the client and its transfer to the marketing manager.

 

About you:

  • 6+ months of work experience in a similar position;
  • English level B2+;
  • know how to find and analyze information;
  • you consider yourself as team player;
  • know how to work with objections;
  • interested in YouTube and video content;
  • understanding of the YouTube platform.

Will be as plus:

  • experience in compiling reports with results and recommendations;
  • understanding Digital Marketing.

 

Why you should join us:

  • We give creative freedom and the opportunity to realize your ideas. We create an atmosphere where everyone is comfortable working, and it is as efficient as possible for the business.
  • Furthermore, we have a strong professional team. At Genesis MCN, we bring together really experienced specialists, each of whom is open to sharing knowledge and is ready to help solve issues based on their experience.
  • Flexibility in decisions - we often have to make absolutely non-standard decisions.

 

In addition, we offer the following benefits:

  • Comfortable conditions and schedule. We provide 20 days of paid vacation per year and a convenient work schedule. 
  • Health care and sports. For example, breakfasts, lunches, unlimited snacks in the office, corporate doctor and health insurance.
  • Communities are the best way to improve skills in a certain field, test hypotheses without harming the business, and find like-minded people. 
  • Training and development: Business and Management School for company employees. A large electronic library and access to paid online courses, conferences, internal discussions, and workshops. Compensation for additional training at external training, courses, and seminars.

 

Join us!
